title: Cats, the movie: why it’ll be even more bizarre than the musical
text:
As Playbill explained upon the 1982 arrival of Andrew Lloyd Webber’s musical on Broadway, "Cats has no plot, no book, no real story line; it is simply an arrangement of 20 of Eliot’s Old Possum poems for dancers and orchestra".

Nearly 40 years on, this remains a deceptively clear summary of one of theatre’s strangest – and most successful – musicals.

When news of a new film adaptation of Cats broke in 2016, most wondered just how it would work. This wasn’t the first time there had been skepticism as to how a narrative based on a handful of poems about anthropomorphised cats could translate to worthwhile entertainment – as Lloyd Webber told The Telegraph in 2014, many people thought he was crazy....
